Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Preoperative Frailty Screening and Optimization Toolkit in Elderly Cancer Patients

Participants.evidence: Patients aged 70 or above undergoing curative intent surgery were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: Practices were randomised 1:1:1 to usual care (UC), OPTI-Surg, or OPTI-Surg with an implementation coach.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the effect of a practice-level preoperative frailty screening and optimization toolkit (OPTI-Surg) on postoperative functional recovery and complications in elderly cancer patients undergoing major surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was 8-week postoperative function (kcal/wk)

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed at the practice level, and allocation concealment was maintained.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From July 2019 to September 2022, 325 patients were enrolled across 29 practices.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 199 (64 UC, 135 OPTI-Surg) and 279 (78 UC, 201 OPTI-Surg) were evaluable for primary and secondary analysis, respectively.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were observed in total caloric expenditure (2.2 UC, 2.0 OPTI-Surg, P = 0.53) or postoperative complications (25.6% UC, 35.3% OPTI-Surg, P = 0.5).
